PPL801.name: Quantitative Methods in Public Policy
PPL801.description: Logic and practice of public policy analysis. Basic research, measurement, design, and data collection issues. Specific skills and techniques for analyzing univariate data. Techniques for examining relationships among variables.
PPL801.restrictions: Open to students in the Master of Public Policy or approval of department.

PPL802.name: Quantitative Methods in Public Policy II
PPL802.description: Intermediate understanding of the logic and practice of public policy analysis. Basic research, measurement, design, and data collection issues. Specific skills and techniques for analyzing multivariate data.
PPL802.restrictions: Open to students in the Master of Public Policy or approval of department.

PPL803.name: Quantitative Methods in Public Policy III
PPL803.description: Advanced understanding of the logic and practice of public policy analysis. Continuation of PPL 802.
PPL803.restrictions: Open to students in the Master of Public Policy or approval of department.

PPL805.name: Microeconomic Theory
PPL805.description: Decision-making by consumers, firms, and governments, and the effect of these decisions on the allocation of market failure and possible government responses.
PPL805.restrictions: Open to students in the Master of Public Policy or approval of department.

PPL806.name: Policy Evaluation
PPL806.description: Theoretical foundations for evaluation research and the practical aspects of conducting evaluations.
PPL806.restrictions: Open to students in the Master of Public Policy or approval of department.

PPL807.name: Public Policy
PPL807.description: Introduction to public policy and the policy-making process.
PPL807.restrictions: Open to students in the Master of Public Policy or approval of department.

PPL808.name: Policy Development and Administration
PPL808.description: Substance and dynamics of public policy-making in the United States. Conceptual foundations of and the practical constraints on governmental activity. Theories, models, and explanations of the policy process.
PPL808.restrictions: Open to students in the Master of Public Policy or approval of department.

PPL813.name: Public Finance
PPL813.restrictions: Open to students in the Master of Public Policy or approval of department.

PPL890.name: Policy Workshop
PPL890.description: Application of substantive and analytic skills to a concrete issue. Students act as a consulting firm to review some specific public policy and produce a summary report capable of informing future policy design.
PPL890.prerequisite: PPL 801 and PPL 802 and PPL 805 and PPL 806 and PPL 807 and PPL 808 and PPL 813
PPL890.restrictions: Open to students in the Master of Public Policy or approval of department.

PPL891.name: Issues in Public Policy
PPL891.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
PPL891.description: Practices and methods in diverse policy settings examined under the tutelage of policy professionals.
PPL891.restrictions: Open to students in the Master of Public Policy or approval of department.

PPL894.name: Field Experience Practicum
PPL894.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
PPL894.description: Experience in administrative settings in the student's field of application. Opportunities to evaluate theories of public policy and administration by engaging in participant observation of the management of public policy.
PPL894.restrictions: Open to students in the Master of Public Policy or approval of department.
